articles.title: Vitamin A may be helping cancer hide from the immune system
articles.description: A vitamin A byproduct has been found to quietly disarm the immune system, allowing tumors to evade attack and weakening cancer vaccines. Scientists have now developed a drug that shuts down this pathway, dramatically boosting immune responses and slowing cancer growth in preclinical studies.

articles.title: A deadly chemical frozen in ice may have sparked life on Earth
articles.description: Hydrogen cyanide, a toxic chemical, may have helped spark the chemistry that led to life. When frozen, it forms crystals with highly reactive surfaces that can drive unusual chemical reactions, even in extreme cold. articles.title: Tage Thompson’s 3-goal, 5-point outing leads Buffalo Sabres to 5-3 win over Montreal Canadiens

articles.title: Those strange red dots in James Webb images finally have an explanation
articles.description: For years, strange red dots in James Webb images left scientists puzzled. New research shows they are young black holes hidden inside dense clouds of gas, glowing as they devour their surroundings.
